message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

The paper proposes modifications to the GAN loss for better anomaly detection, which is a problem in machine learning and falls under the category of "Learning" (cs.LG). The experiments are conducted on image datasets such as MNIST and CIFAR10, indicating the relevance of computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The proposed method also involves using the discriminator score as an anomaly threshold, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) for anomaly detection. The paper also discusses the limitations of traditional anomaly detection methods, which can be considered as a topic in computer security and cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the proposed modifications to the GAN loss involve adjusting the generated samples to lie at the boundary of the real data distribution, which can be seen as a neural network optimization problem (cs.NE).
